isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL RIDE OPTIMIZED SUSPENSION (IROS) - component installation

svcprocinfo.para: This manual section is set up for the component installation. Only International Truck and Engine certified parts should be used for the installation procedures to insure proper fit and service of the vehicle suspension system.

step1.para: Install replacement air spring assembly and tighten fasteners to specified torque values. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Connect air line to air spring and install height control valve linkage at lower end.
Build vehicle system air pressure to governor cutout pressure and use soap solution to check for leaks.
Check for proper ride height adjustment. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT.
Position shock absorber and install mounting bolts.
Tighten shock mounting fasteners to specified torque values. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.

svcsubproc.title: main support members

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Inspect all parts for wear, cracks or failed welds. Repair or replace.

caution.para: Do not repair a cracked spring, U-bolt or spacer plates. The listed parts must be replaced if cracks are present.

svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the MAIN SUPPORT MEMBER assembly, a careful inspection of component parts including tapered leaf spring mounting bushing should be undertaken. Only authorized International parts should be used in the installation procedure.

Position spring to approximate installed position (Figure 17) and install the bar pin in hanger on the forward side of the spring hanger. Also install lower shock bracket end and do not tighten fasteners (Figure 21).

step1.para: Locate main support member end with (Figure 13, Item 5) bushing assembly, at the forward suspension mounting bracket (Figure 22, Item 1).
Insert bolt and hand tighten.
Place axle seat bracket on main support member with alignment pin, axle seat bracket forward mark indicator should be facing in forward direction.
Place u-bolts and u-bolt axle top mounting bracket on axle assembly.
Install air spring assembly to top bracket mounted on chassis frame (Figure 16, Item 4).
Align and install lower u-bolt mounting plate, install u-bolt nuts and hand tighten (Figure 22, Items 2 and 3).
Insert mounting nut on air spring threaded stud and hand tighten.
Locate and install shock absorber to upper shock absorber mounting bracket. Install bolts and hand tighten (Figure 20, Items 1, 2 and 3).
Place lower air spring mounting stud in applicable mounting hole in rear of tapered leaf spring (Figure 13, Item 1).
Tighten all mounting hardware to appropriate values as indicated in the torque chart.

When all torque requirements are met and installations complete, follow procedures for re-inflating suspension to proper ride height. See the first section and appropriate subsection for correct ride height procedures.
Place U-bolt seat on top of spring (Figure 23, Item 2) with tab towards vehicle frame then install U-bolt assembly to spring and axle. Do not tighten fasteners to specified values at this time.

At this point assemble the spring clamp group and main support member to the axle, align the suspension and tighten assembly. Tighten to specifications in the following sequence: U-bolts (tighten diagonally), (Figure 28) front torque rod nuts, rear torque rod nuts, and the lower shock absorber mounting plate on the transverse beam. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Connect lower air spring, shock absorbers and height control valve linkage and any air lines that were removed. Tighten all fasteners to values specified. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Install tires/wheels. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS in the Master Service Manual.
Lower vehicle. Remove all stands.
Build vehicle air pressure to governor cutout pressure and use soap and water solution to check for leaks.
Install replacement torque rods (be sure to use correct length torque rods for vehicle), connecting the end to the frame side rail first and end to axles second (for transverse rods).
Tighten fasteners to specified torque values. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Recheck axle alignment. Adjust if necessary.

svcsubproc.title: main support member bushings

specpara.para: TO INSURE PROPER MOUNTING OF NEW BUSHING, CLEAN MAIN SUPPORT MEMBER WHERE BUSHING IS TO BE PRESS FITTED WITH DEGREASING FLUID AND WIRE BRUSH. USE DRILL MOUNTED WIRE BRUSH ONLY.

svcsubproc.para: Apply 1/4- 1/2" wide ring of bonding agent to lower quarter of bushing as shown (Figure 26, Item 2), before pressing into spring eye.
Apply 1/4- 1/2" ring of bonding agent to top edge of eye I.D. (Figure 27, Items 1 and 3), as shown, before installing bushing.

para.emph: NOTE: Unless otherwise specified, minimum push out force after 24 hours cure is 6750 lbs. for threaded bushings and 4000 lbs. for all other bushings.

svcsubproc.para: Bushing must be clean and free of oil and grease prior to installation.
After bushing installation, residual bonding agent must be removed.

note.para: When tightening spring U-bolts, torque rod fasteners and other related mounting fasteners to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the bushings. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for specified torque values.

step1.para: Inspect the U-bolt threads and U-bolt nuts for rust and debris and clean the threads if contaminated.
Install the U-bolts and nuts and torque the nuts to 15 lbf-ft, using a diagonal pattern.
Re-torque the nuts to 100 lbf-ft, using a diagonal pattern.
Re- torque the nuts to 200 lbf-ft, using a diagonal pattern.
Re-torque the nuts to 300 lbf-ft, using a diagonal pattern.
Re-torque the nuts to 425 lbf-ft, using a diagonal pattern.
Use the same diagonal pattern with each U-bolt nut re-torque.
